sentence: Technology stocks are sliding today with shares of technology companies in the S&P 500 down nearly 1% as a group.

In company news, ChinaCache ( CCIH ) climbed today after saying its American depository shares - each representing 16 common shares of the Chinese online content and applications delivery company - transferred to the NASDAQ Global Select Market, effective today.
ADS were up about 5% at $9.36 each in recent trading after climbing to an $9.57 intra-day peak.
The stock has a 52-week range of $3.50 to $10.64 per ADS.
(+) PLUG, (+39.4%, near 52 week highs) Fuel-cell manufacturer today said it met its projected order targets for 2013 with around $32 million in Q4 bookings.
Clients included Wal-Mart ( WMT ), Kroger ( KR ), Coca-Cola ( KO ), Procter & Gamble ( PG ) and CVS (CVS).
(-) XRX (-2.7% from near 52 week highs) 3D Systems (DDD) today completes its $32.5 mln acquisition of the company's solid-ink development labs, engineering and development teams and patent portfolio.
The views and opinions expressed herein are the views and opinions of the author and do not necessarily reflect those of Nasdaq, Inc.
